goal: Explain inflation in very simple terms
steps: Inflation is when the prices of things—like food, clothes, and services—go up over time. This means that the same amount of money buys you less than it used to. For example, if a loaf of bread used to cost $1 and now it costs $1.50, that’s inflation. It usually happens because there’s more money in the economy or because things cost more to make. So, essentially, inflation means your money doesn’t stretch as far as it used to.
